chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Gronowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Defendant to submit to random testing.  No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Only one prescriber of prescription unless an emergency and must advise of probationary terms. Maintain employment. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.

Clerk received a phone call before court from a caller stating he was Atty. Ben Levy requesting an adjournment. Clerk verified with Atty. Levy's office that he was not calling our office. Caller notified request to adjourn case today at 3:15 pm is denied.  Clerk later received a phone message from defendant, after case was called and warrant issued, stating he could not appear in court today, he did not have a ride.

Attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Sisley informs the court defendant called his office and stated he could not find a ride to court. Court orders a bench warrant issued, bail forfeited.
